etymology.description: Pictogram: a plant sprout (屮) with a dot in the middle, later transformed into a horizontal line; compare the top component of 春 in early forms.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a young shoot pushing up through the soil, with an added stroke emphasizing the sprout. The dot evolved into a horizontal line over time, paralleling early forms seen atop 春.

examples.chinese: 军队在边境屯兵(軍隊在邊境屯兵)。
examples.english: The army garrisoned troops at the border.

examples.chinese: 他在松花江边的一个小屯长大(他在松花江邊的一個小屯長大)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài Sōnghuājiāng biān de yí gè xiǎo tún zhǎngdà.
examples.english: He grew up in a small hamlet by the Songhua River.

examples.chinese: 朝廷在北地实行屯田(朝廷在北地實行屯田)。
examples.pinyin: Cháotíng zài běidì shíxíng tún tián.
examples.english: The court implemented garrison-farming in the north.
